comment._content: Out with the old, in with the new. This pairs with the adjacent pic in the set, here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/page132/ and the new motor fire engine of that other photograph can be seen in the background of this one, and it looks like the same fire house too.

comment._content: Good link Nieuwenhis Fotografie - it looks like the "little giant" too: www.nyc.gov/html/fdny/html/f_a/e39_5.shtml

comment.author: 46317563@N04
comment._content: There is an illustration of the Engine No. 39 and Hook and Ladder No. 16 Bldg. and Tower in the NYPL Digital Gallery: digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?804707 The station is located in the Upper East Side, East 67th St.

comment.author: 7364400@N04
comment._content: Dear Library of Congress, please note that, at the bottom-right of that photo, there is stamped a date which inscribes 'FEB 02 1912' which might indicate the date of when that photo was taken.
